page.title: 01COME TO BRAFFERTON HELPERBY
page.content: Our village is actually two villages, Brafferton and Helperby, which are so close they run together. They are situated in the vale of York on the River Swale, sixteen miles from York and Harrogate, ten miles from Ripon and Thirsk. There are about 9oo people who live in the village.Main Street runs north to south with shops and houses on either side. There are no front gardens just a broad stretch of cobblestones with a few trees bordering the road, mountain ash have recently been planted to join the old chestnut trees.Most of the houses on Main Street have long hidden back gardens. In the centre of the street is a fountain/pump which cars use as a roundabout. Also there is a war memorial and the Hall. In the Hall lived Lady Celia Milnes Coates. She had her 100th birthday and then,last
